casebody.data:
Francis H. Ferry, Respondent, v. The Manhattan Railway Company, Appellant. Decided May 6, 1889. Appeal by defendant from judgment entered in favor of the plaintiff upon the verdict of a jury, and from order denying defendant’s motion for a new trial. Davies & Rapallo, for appellant. Benjamin G. Hitchings, for respondent.

Before Freedman and O’Gorman, JJ.

The Court held (Per Curiam),

that the exceptions urged *597on the appeal were • without merit, and affirmed the judgment and order with costs.
